DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.

Concepts.definition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Classification; the grouping of things into classes or categories.

Concepts.definition: A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: NINDS:National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke Common Data Element Project
DataElementConcept.changeDescription:
12/07/2016 created version 2.0 to replace version 1.0 for trail making test CDE harmonization, wz.

5/25/18 - smt CDE transferred to NCIP ownership per NINDS (Muniza Sheikh) request.

It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.:Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
